posts.author: disturbed
posts.content:
New to NWN and RP in general. I was pointed here by a friend.

What I am looking for is a Mercenary type character that uses the Rogue and CoT classes. Fighter possibly as the third? 

Concept would be more on the survival side more since I am new to the game.

If any more information is needed just let me know. I appreciate the help.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hello and welcome to the new ECB Disturbed, if you don't mind i would like to ask you a few questions first about the build.

1) You want this for a persistent world or a module?
2) Can you tell us some things about this PW, like if Devastating Critical is allowed?
3) Is there some specific reason why do you want CoT in there? Is it for the saves alone?
4) You want to focus first on the offense or having first and foremost a strong defense?
5) What is the general level of magic enchantments at level 30? Are for example +6 weapons a common place or we are talking about a low/medium type of magic world?
6) You would like a dexterity-based or a strength-based character?

Thank you in advance,

posts.author: disturbed
posts.content:
1) You want this for a persistent world or a module?
- PW , Amia to be exact.
2) Can you tell us some things about this PW, like if Devastating Critical is allowed?
- From everything I have read it seems to be!
3) Is there some specific reason why do you want CoT in there? Is it for the saves alone?
- Honestly it just seemed like a solid add on to the rogue to increase his ability to survive. So yes the saves are part of that.
4) You want to focus first on the offense or having first and foremost a strong defense?
- Defense I would think though I am pretty new to the game. Maybe a strong offensive character would be better for killing quick thus less need for survival?
5) What is the general level of magic enchantments at level 30? Are for example +6 weapons a common place or we are talking about a low/medium type of magic world?
- I'm not sure to be honest.
6) You would like a dexterity-based or a strength-based character?
- Strength based would seem to be more what I was going for. Sword and shield type or DW doesn't matter.

Also I'd prefer Human first as I learn to RP before I jump into other races.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Alright then, a pretty iconic knight-ish like character with sword and shield, that incorporates some of the evasive techniques of a rogue. The combination of these three classes is one of the best in NwN and ideal for your first character if i might say.

Just for reference and for anyone else that is interested here is the link with the changes on Amia server (found via google-fu), please correct me if i am wrong.
